intro: Bidens socorrensis, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, often arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it adaptable to various environmental conditions. Bidens socorrensis is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in some regions for its purported healing benefits.
